channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sam Altman denies reports he will get a gargantuan equity stake in OpenAI as it restructures
item.description: Altman said there are “no current plans” to give him equity in the company.

item.title: ‘Sell in May’ was a costly mistake. But should you buy now?
Port strike could come at a ‘high political cost’ for Harris campaign
Fly to Europe from the U.S. for less than $100—but you’ll have to act fast
item.description: Budget Icelandic airline PLAY has announced $99 flights from the US to Amsterdam, Berlin, Copenhagen, Dublin, Liverpool, Paris and Reykjavik.

item.title: Recent hurricanes have caused over $200 billion in damage
item.description: The most recent major hurricanes to hit the U.S. left hundreds of people dead and caused billions of dollars worth of damage.

item.title: EchoStar nears deal to sell Dish to DirecTV with $2 billion debt payment looming, sources say
item.description: While EchoStar and DirecTV hope to complete a deal by Monday, no deal is assured, and the talks may still fall apart.

item.title: U.S. stock market ends week higher despite the chill; Asia rallies on stimulus
item.description: China stocks closed out their best week since 2008 as the country's central bank cut its reserve requirement for banks.

item.title: Trump calls for prosecution of Google over search results he says favor Harris
item.description: Donald Trump claimed Google was showing only "good stories" about Vice President Kamala Harris, his presidential election opponent.

item.title: Elon Musk's X will be allowed back online in Brazil after paying one more fine
item.description: X has to pay one last fine before getting reinstated in Brazil, according to a decision out Friday from the country's top justice, Alexandre de Moraes...

item.title: The S&P 500 hit multiple records this week, but it's still Nvidia's market
item.description: As stocks notched fresh record highs this week, the dominant artificial intelligence player remained essential to the broader market's upward move.

item.title: Paul Bilzerian avoided a $180 million fine for years. The SEC finally caught up.
OpenAI sees roughly $5 billion loss this year on $3.7 billion in revenue
item.description: CNBC has confirmed that OpenAI expects about $5 billion in losses on $3.7 billion in revenue this year — figures first reported by The New York Times.

item.title: Nvidia’s stock chart shows how bulls are using the recent pause to refresh
Dow clinches record close as U.S. stocks book weekly gains
Experts warn EV owners of fire risk from Hurricane Helene
item.description: Keeping electric vehicles out of standing water is the best way to avoid the possibility of a fire.
